name: TheUser1024
text: I really do not have an answer for you. But a similar experience. Had a DLink Router (no WLAN) and it was SEEMINGLY very sensitive to slight voltage drops on the 230V End (maybe less input V thus drawing more A than it can take!?). I did not take any measurements or such, so please take all of this with a big grain of salt. When i switched on big loads like a washing machine, the connection dropped. The symptom has vanished since i got a new router. And yes, there might be more complex electrical issues involved here, not my cup of tea. :-) Compared to that old DLink my new FritzBox rocks btw.
